titles.title: Dǝrsan maḥyawi “The Life-Giving Homily”/ Säʿatat zä-mäʿalt “Horologium for the Day Hours”

shortcontents.shortcontent: I) Dǝrsan maḥyawi “The Life-Giving Homily” (fols. 2r-71vb l.4) I-1) Introductory prayer (fols. 2r-2va l.2) I-2) Reading for Monday, Compline (nǝwam) (fols. 2va l.4-14rb l.5); containing homily (fols. 2va l.4-6va l.12; 6vb l.9-9rb l.11; 9va l.8-12rb l.4), absolution prayer (fols. 6va l.13-6vb l.9; 9rb l.12-9va l.8; 12rb l.5-12va l.2) and ʾarke (fols. 12va l.3-14rb l.5) I-3) Reading for Tuesday, Matins (mänfäqä lelit) (fols. 14ra l.8 -23vb l.10); containing homily (fols. 14ra l.8-19vb l.1; 19vb l.19-21va l.9; 21vb l.8-22va l.5), absolution prayer (fols. 19vb l.2-19vb l.18; 21va l.10-21vb l.7) and ʾarke (fols. 22va l.6-23vb l.10) I-4) Reading for Wednesday, Lauds (nägh) (fols. 23vb l.11-32vb l.15); containing homily (fols. 23vb l.11-29ra l.4; 29rb l.5-30ra l.9; 30rb l.10-31rb l.5), absolution prayer (fols. 29ra l.5-29rb l.4; 30ra l.10-30rb l.9; 31rb l.6-31va l.4) and ʾarke (fols. 31va l.5-32vb l.15) I-5) Reading for Thursday, Terce (śälästu säʿat) (fols. 32vb l.16-43vb); containing homily (fols. 32vb l.16-38va l.7; 38vb l.8-40rb l.6; 40va l.5-42rb), absolution prayer (fols. 38va l.8-38vb l.7; 40rb l.7-40va l.4; 42va-42va l.17) and ʾarke (fols. 42va l.18-43vb) I-6) Reading for Friday, Sext (qätr) (fols. 44ra-54rb l.1); containing homily (fols. 44ra-45va l.14; 46vb l.7-48ra l.13; 48va l.10-51rb l.17; 51va l.15-52ra l.14), absolution prayer (fols. 48ra l.14-48va l.9; 51rb l.18-51va l.14; 52rb l.15-52va l.12), 2 miracles (fols. 45va l.14-46vb l.6; 52ra l.15-52rb l.14) and ʾarke (fols. 52va l.13-54rb l.1) I-7) Reading for Saturday, None (täsaʿtu säʿat) (fols. 54rb l.2-64vb l.13); containing homily (fols. 54rb l.2-57ra l.14; 57rb l.14-60va l.8; 62ra l.4-63ra l.5), miracle (fols. 60va l.9-61vb l.7), absolution prayer (fols. 57ra l.15-57rb l.13; 61vb l.8-62ra l.3; 63ra l.6-63rb l.3) and ʾarke (fols. 63rb l.4-64vb l.13) I-8) Reading for Sunday, Vespers (śärk) (fols. 64vb l.15); containing homily (fols. 64vb l.15-67va l.13; 67vb l.12-69ra l.18; 79rb l.16-70ra), absolution prayer (fols. 67va l.14-67vb l.11; 69ra l.19-79rb l.15; 70rb-70rbl.16) and ʾarke (fols. 70rbl.17-71vb l.4) II) Säʿatat zä-mäʿalt “Horologium for the Day Hours” (fols. 71va l.6-79rb): zä-nägh (fols. 71va l.6-72va l.4); zä-śäläst (fols. 72va l.4-73rb l.3); zä-qätr (fols. 73rb l.4-74rb l.14); zä-täsäʿatu säʿat (fols. 74rb l.15-75rb l.6); zä-śärk (fols. 75rb l.7-76rb l.3); zä-nǝwam (fols. 76rb l.4-77rb l.14); zä-mänfäqä lelit (fols. 77rb l.15-79rb l.9); concluding prayer (fol. 79rb l.10-19).

locationlink.xlink:title: QiËat DÃ¤brÃ¤ á¹¢Çyon QÇddÇst Maryam / QDS

donors.donor: The following names are written in the supplication formulas of Text I: Wäldä Ḥǝywät (fol. 12va), Wälättä Maryam (fols. 14rb, 22va, 33ra, 44ra, 64vb, 69rb) Gäbrä Ḥǝywät (fol. 19vb), Täklä Maryam (fols. 23vb, 30rb, 63rb, 70rb), ʾabunä Kidanä Maryam (fols. 29vb, 64vb), Wälättä Mädḫǝn (fols. 40va, 57rb, 67vb), Zärʿa Buruk (fol. 54ra), Wälättä Mikaʾel (fol. 31va, 32vb, 71vb) and Wäldä ʾAbiyä ʾƎgziʾ (fol. 38vb). The last two names are written in a secondary hand.

txstates.txstate: Holes are carefully amended in fols. 32, 53, 63, 68, 72, 75, 79.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather; textile inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover (at least 5 tools were used: triple line fillet, double circle, x-form, cross hatching, interlaced line fillet).

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover.

squires.squire: A(1; s.l.: 1, stub after 1/fol. 1) – I(8/fols. 2r-9v) ፪II(8/fols. 10r-17v) – ፫III(8/fols. 18r-25v) – ፬IV(8/fols. 26r-33v) – ፭V(8/fols. 34r-41v) – ፮VI(8/fols. 42r-49v) – ፯VII(8/fols. 50r-57v) – ፰VIII(8/fols. 58r-65v) – ፱IX(8; s.l.: 2, stub after 6; 7, stub after 1/fols. 66r-73v) – ፲X(6; s.l.: 1, stub after 6; 2, stub after 6/fols. 74r-79v).

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Hairlines extending horizontal elements of the majority of letters and their derivations (e.g., መ አ ነ).

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; names of the donors; 1st, 2nd, 6th, 7th, 13th and 14th line on the incipit page of Text I; two initial lines of parts of Text II; a few lines of the beginning of the daily readings and their sections in Text I; the words sälam läki, sǝḥat läkä and their abbreviations in Text II; elements of punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals. The names Wälättä Mikaʾel (fol. 31va, 32vb, 71vb) and Wäldä ʾAbiyä ʾƎgzʾi (fol. 38vb) are written in strong crimson.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: Decorated quire marks are written in the upper margin of the first fol. of the quire: fols. 10r, 18r, 26r, 34r, 42r, 50r, 58r, 66r, 74r.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Names of the days of the week, written in the upper margins in a secondary hand, indicate daily readings: 14ra, 23vb, 32vb, 54ra, 64va. - Readings for the parts of the day are indicated by their names written within ornamented frames in the upper margin: fols. 72va, 73rb, 74rb, 75rb, 76rb, 77rb.

frames.frame: Fol. 2r: Coloured (red, black) horizontal ornamental band with geometric motifs. Fol. 64v: Coloured (red, black) horizontal ornamental band with geometric motifs.
